title: Francisco Manuel Vieira
text:
Francisco Manuel Vieira (29 October 1925 – 23 December 2013) was a Brazilian <a href="Catholic">Catholic</a> bishop.
Vieira was born in the <a href="Portugal">portuguese</a> town of <a href="Rio%20Tinto%20%28Gondomar%29">Rio Tinto (Gondomar)</a> and was ordained in <a href="Brazil">Brazil</a> to the priesthood in 1952. He served as <a href="titular%20bishop">titular bishop</a> of "Hippo Diarrhytus" and was <a href="auxiliary%20bishop">auxiliary bishop</a> of the <a href="Roman%20Catholic%20Diocese%20of%20S%C3%A3o%20Paulo">Roman Catholic Diocese of São Paulo</a>, Brazil, from 1974 to 1989. He then served as bishop of the <a href="Roman%20Catholic%20Diocese%20of%20Osasco">Roman Catholic Diocese of Osasco</a>, Brazil from 1989 to 2002.
